# Conferences

## Annual Biomedical Research Conference for Minoritized Scientists (ABRCMS), 2024

<div class="conf-card">
  <img src="ABRCMS.jpg.gif" alt="ABRCMS 2024" style="width:100%; border-radius:10px; margin-bottom:10px;">
  <h3 style="margin-top:0;">ABRCMS 2024 â€“ Poster Presentation</h3>
  <p><strong>Title:</strong> Technologies for Transition: A Survey of Assistive Technologies for Individuals with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) During the Transition to Adulthood</p>
</div>

At ABRCMS 2024, I presented research on how assistive technologies can support adolescents and young adults with ASD as they navigate key life transitions such as higher education, employment, and independent living.  
This work was supported by mentors including **Dr. Neal Simon**, **Dr. Ware**, **Prof. Fathima Wakeel**, and **Prof. Vinod Namboodiri**, and highlighted the importance of improving resources and systems for neurodivergent individuals while advancing diversity and inclusion in STEM.

## World Congress in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, & Applied Computing (CSCE'24) â€“ HIMS'24, 2024

<div class="conf-card">
  <img src="CSC.gif" alt="CSCE'24 / HIMS'24" style="width:100%; border-radius:10px; margin-bottom:10px;">
  <h3 style="margin-top:0;">CSCE'24 â€“ 10th International Conference on Health Informatics & Medical Systems (HIMS'24)</h3>
  <p><strong>Presentation:</strong> Explainable Machine Learning-Based Alzheimer's Disease Prediction</p>
</div>

At **CSCE'24** in Las Vegas, I presented our work on leveraging handwriting data and explainable machine learning models for early detection of Alzheimerâ€™s disease.  
In collaboration with **Prof. Gideon Gogovi**, we demonstrated how handwriting-derived features can serve as promising, non-invasive markers for early AD screening and personalized intervention strategies.  
This research was supported by the **Lehigh University College of Health** and the **Dean of Students**, and has been published by **Springer**.

## Lehigh University College of Health Research Symposium (2022â€“2024) & STEM-SI Program 2024

<div class="conf-card">
  <img src="StemSi.jpg.gif" alt="Lehigh College of Health Research Symposium" style="width:100%; border-radius:10px; margin-bottom:10px;">
  <h3 style="margin-top:0;">College of Health Research Symposia & STEM-SI Program</h3>
  <p><strong>Presentations:</strong> Assistive Technologies for ASD & Global Health/Community-Engaged Projects</p>
</div>

Across multiple years (2022â€“2024), I presented research at the **Lehigh University College of Health Research Symposium**, including work on assistive technologies for individuals with ASD and community-engaged health projects.  
As part of the **STEM-SI program**, I conducted a comprehensive review of assistive technologies supporting transition-age individuals with ASD and learned about the **CityGuide** assistive technology system, which supports indoor navigation for individuals with disabilities.  
These experiences strengthened my interests in global health, disability, and technology-driven solutions.

## Global Health Learning Lab, Lehigh Valley Health Network, 2022

<div class="conf-card">
  <img src="globallearning.jpeg" alt="Global Health Learning Lab 2022" style="width:100%; border-radius:10px; margin-bottom:10px;">
  <h3 style="margin-top:0;">Global Health Learning Lab â€“ Lehigh Valley Health Network</h3>
  <p><strong>Topic:</strong> Healthcare Disparities and the Health System in Sierra Leone</p>
</div>

As part of the **Global Social Impact Fellowship (ASTIA)**, I contributed to a Global Health Learning Lab session for resident physicians at Lehigh Valley Health Network.  
I presented on healthcare disparities and the structure of the health system in **Sierra Leone**, drawing on fieldwork focused on autism screening and community perceptions of disability.  
This work was closely linked to our efforts to develop culturally appropriate autism screening tools for West African communities.

---

## Engagement Scholarship Consortium (ESC), 2022

<div class="conf-card">
  <img src="ESC.jpeg" alt="Engagement Scholarship Consortium 2022" style="width:100%; border-radius:10px; margin-bottom:10px;">
  <h3 style="margin-top:0;">Engagement Scholarship Consortium (ESC), 2022</h3>
  <p><strong>Poster Presentation:</strong> Autism Screening and Training in Africa (ASTIA)</p>
</div>

At the **Engagement Scholarship Consortium (ESC) 2022**, I presented a poster on the **Autism Screening and Training in Africa (ASTIA)** project, highlighting strategies for proactive community engagement and partner involvement in research.  
Our work emphasized building sustainable, equitable partnerships, elevating local perspectives on disability, and designing tools that are both scientifically rigorous and culturally grounded.
